p: Despite these conditions, people in Papua Island still depend on traditional medicine. According to Triratnawati (2017), traditional medical practices are hereditary and dominant since many areas have not been reached with the modern health system. Also, one of the local wisdom is the use of plant-based materials in treating various diseases. RISKESDAS 2018 also showed the preference of people in both provinces in preparing their traditional medicine for treating various diseases. This is shown by the high proportion in the use of traditional homemade concoctions, which was approximately 81.7% in Papua and 70.8% in West Papua [ 17, 25, 27].
